intro: Pilea cruzensis, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Begoniaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including China, India, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its round, succulent leaves that resemble coins, hence its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Pilea cruzensis is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
